data.meta_description: Discover life events, stories and photos about John Peter Crone (1845â1935) of Abbottstown, Adams, Pennsylvania, United States.
data.text:
John Peter Crone was born on 29 June 1845, in Abbottstown, Adams, Pennsylvania, United States. He married Sarah A Wagner on 27 December 1866, in Straban Township, Adams, Pennsylvania, United States. They were the parents of at least 4 sons and 1 daughter. He lived in Carroll Township, York, Pennsylvania, United States for about 10 years. He died on 12 March 1935, in Franklintown, York, Pennsylvania, United States, at the age of 89, and was buried in Dillsburg, York, Pennsylvania, United States.

1846

U.S. acquires vast tracts of Mexican territory in wake of Mexican War including California and New Mexico.

1863 Â· Battle of Gettysburg

The three day Battle of Gettysburg was one of the bloodiest of the American Civil War. Between the Confederates and Unions, somewhere between 46,000 and 51,000 people died that day.

1870 Â· The Fifteenth Amendment

Prohibits the federal government and each state from denying a citizen the right to vote based on that citizen's race, color, or previous condition of servitude. It was the last of the Reconstruction Amendments.
